sandwiches.description: Generally served hot, and often eaten with ketchup or brown sauce
sandwiches.name: Bacon

sandwiches.description: A breakfast sandwich, usually fried or scrambled eggs
sandwiches.name: Bacon, egg and cheese

sandwiches.description: Canned baked beans on white or brown bread. Sometimes butter is also used.
sandwiches.name: Baked bean

sandwiches.description: Filling is typically meat, but can contain a wide range of foods, including sardines, tofu, pâté, or eggs. Served on an airy baguette with pickled carrots, cilantro and peppers.
sandwiches.name: Bánh mì

sandwiches.description: Served on a bun, with chopped or sliced meat (pulled pork, beef or chicken typically), and sometimes topped with coleslaw
sandwiches.name: Barbecue

sandwiches.description: Ham and cheese, usually mantecoso, which is similar to farmer cheese
sandwiches.name: Barros Jarpa

sandwiches.description: Beef (usually thin cut steak) and cheese
sandwiches.name: Barros Luco

sandwiches.description: Melted cheese, roast beef, tomato and pickled cucumber in a hollowed-out French roll
sandwiches.name: Bauru

sandwiches.description: Roast beef on a caraway kaiser roll
sandwiches.name: Beef on weck

sandwiches.description: Named for its ingredients: bacon, lettuce and tomato
sandwiches.name: BLT

sandwiches.description: Pre-sliced, sometimes fried bologna sausage between slices of white bread, along with various condiments, such as ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise.
sandwiches.name: Bologna sandwich

sandwiches.description: Usually grilled on white bread, containing a bratwurst sausage, onions, and a blend of tomato ketchup, mustard, and curry powder
sandwiches.name: Bosna

sandwiches.description: A convenience dish on a variety of bread rolls, containing such breakfast items as sausages, bacon, white or black pudding, mushrooms, tomatoes, hash browns and fried eggs, often eaten with ketchup or brown sauce,
sandwiches.name: Breakfast roll

sandwiches.description: Typically a scrambled or fried egg, cheese, and a sausage patty or other breakfast meat served on a biscuit or English muffin
sandwiches.name: Breakfast

sandwiches.description: A dated reference to the poor quality of catering on the now-defunct British Rail, refers to any poor-quality sandwich, often stale.
sandwiches.name: British Rail

sandwiches.description: A soft bread roll containing a ragout-based croquette. It is often eaten with mustard.
sandwiches.name: Broodje kroket

sandwiches.description: Consists of a spicy patty which is shallow-fried, onions, and chutney or raita in a hamburger or hot dog bun.
sandwiches.name: Bun kebab

sandwiches.description: Single, open-faced, containing butter as the common ingredient, with sweet or savory toppings depending on the meal
sandwiches.name: Butterbrot

sandwiches.description: Sliced avocado, meat, white cheese, onions and red sauce (salsa roja), on a fluffy sesame-seeded egg roll, originally from the city of Puebla.
sandwiches.name: Cemita

sandwiches.description: Thinly sliced churrasco-style steak, or lomito-style pork, with tomatoes, green beans and green chiles, served on a round roll
sandwiches.name: Chacarero

sandwiches.description: In the United States it is usually made with American cheese, and often served toasted alongside tomato soup or with sliced tomato inside. When toasted (pictured), it is commonly referred to as a "grilled cheese sandwich".
sandwiches.name: Cheese

sandwiches.description: Slices of cheese (typically Cheddar) and pickle (a sweet, vinegary chutney with the most popular brand being Branston), sandwiched between two slices of bread.
sandwiches.name: Cheese and pickle

sandwiches.description: Thinly sliced steak and melted cheese in a long roll, also known as a Philadelphia or Philly cheesesteak.
sandwiches.name: Cheesesteak

sandwiches.description: A sandwich prepared with chicken salad as a filling.
sandwiches.name: Chicken salad

sandwiches.description: Chickpea salad is a vegan sandwich filling that has a texture similar to tuna salad. Chickpea salad consists of mashed up chickpeas, vegenaise, onions, and other seasonings. Some versions also include tuna.
sandwiches.name: Chickpea salad

sandwiches.description: A hamburger, with the patty topped with chili con carne
sandwiches.name: Chili burger

sandwiches.description: Sliced white bread (or a large, flat bread roll) filled with chips usually sprinkled with salt and vinegar or tomato ketchup.
sandwiches.name: Chip butty

sandwiches.description: Sandwiches prepared with thinly sliced or pressed salted and dried beef. Some chipped beef is smoked to add flavor.
sandwiches.name: Chipped beef

sandwiches.description: Filet mignon with mozzarella, tomatoes, mayonnaise, and commonly bacon, black or green olives, fried or hardboiled eggs and ham
sandwiches.name: Chivito

sandwiches.description: Grilled chorizo, usually served on a crusty roll with salsa-type condiments, such as pebre, salsa criolla or chimichurri. Morcipán is a variety of this using black pudding or blood sausage.
sandwiches.name: Choripán

sandwiches.description: A brown gravy base and chow mein mixture in a hamburger-style bun
sandwiches.name: Chow mein

sandwiches.description: Thinly cut steak, grilled and served on a toasted bun, usually with tomato, avocado and mayonnaise
sandwiches.name: Churrasco

sandwiches.description: A triple-decker sandwich made with sliced turkey or chicken, bacon, tomato and lettuce, usually contains mayonnaise
sandwiches.name: Club

sandwiches.description: Corned beef with mustard, usually on rye bread
sandwiches.name: Corned beef

sandwiches.description: Crisps and occasionally pickles on white bread
sandwiches.name: Crisp

sandwiches.description: A grilled ham and cheese (typically Emmental or Gruyère) sandwich, sometimes coated in a mornay or béchamel sauce
sandwiches.name: Croque-monsieur

sandwiches.description: Ham, roasted pork, Swiss cheese, pickles, mustard, and sometimes Genoa salami on Cuban bread, usually pressed and warmed in a plancha
sandwiches.name: Cuban

sandwiches.description: Two thin slices of crustless, lightly buttered white bread, containing paper-thin slices of peeled cucumber
sandwiches.name: Cucumber

sandwiches.description: Spicy cudighi (a Michigan variety of Cotechino Italian sausage), on a long, hard roll, often topped with mozzarella and tomato sauce
sandwiches.name: Cudighi

sandwiches.description: Multiple layers containing a wide variety of meats and condiments, named for Dagwood Bumstead of the comic strip Blondie
sandwiches.name: Dagwood

sandwiches.description: Type of sandwich that may be ordered at a deli, choices include type of bread (toasted or untoasted,) type of meat (cold cut), type of sliced cheese, vegetable fillings (lettuce, tomato, onion, etc.) and condiments
sandwiches.name: Deli sandwich

sandwiches.description: A sandwich containing a Denver omelette
sandwiches.name: Denver

sandwiches.description: Doner kebab is meat cooked on a vertical spit, normally veal or beef but also may be a mixture of these with lamb, and sometimes chicken that may be served wrapped in a flatbread such as lavash or pita or as a sandwich.
sandwiches.name: Doner kebab

sandwiches.description: Chopped or shredded, savory donkey meat in a bun, sold in Baoding, Hebei Province as street food, and also in high-end restaurants
sandwiches.name: Donkey burger

sandwiches.description: Two flat fried bara (bread), containing curried chickpeas or garbanzo beans
sandwiches.name: Doubles

sandwiches.description: Made of ground beef, tomato sauces, spices and many onions and peppers. It is a popular food served at local family gatherings and fund raising benefits, usually made in large quantities.
sandwiches.name: Dynamite

sandwiches.description: On a piece of dark rye bread, a layer of leverpostej, topped with a slice of salt beef and a slice of meat aspic, topped with raw onion rings and garden cress.
sandwiches.name: Dyrlægens natmad

sandwiches.description: Peanut butter, banana, and bacon inside of two slices of bread
sandwiches.name: Elvis sandwich

sandwiches.description:
Generic sandwich: This contains eggs, usually sliced hard boiled eggs or egg salad, but may be made with fried or (more rarely) scrambled egg, topped with the local roe spread, locally called kaviar.
Egg salad sandwich: A chopped egg mixed with mayonaise.
Eggs Benedict is an open-faced sandwich consisting of an English muffin topped with meat, eggs, and hollandaise sauce.
sandwiches.name: Egg

sandwiches.description: White bread with nonpareils (= 'sprinkles' (U.S.) or 'hundreds and thousands' (U.K.)) on a spread of butter. Often cut into squares or triangles.
sandwiches.name: Fairy bread

sandwiches.description: Deep-fried balls of ground, seasoned chickpeas topped with salad vegetables, hot sauce, tahini-based sauces, and pickled vegetables, wrapped in or added to the pocket of a split-open pita bread.
sandwiches.name: Falafel

sandwiches.description: Crusty bread rolls filled with fish (most commonly Bismarck or soused herring) and onions
sandwiches.name: Fischbrötchen

sandwiches.description: Consists of a single warmed, hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with one jar of creamy peanut butter, one jar of grape jelly, and a pound of bacon. In 1976, Elvis Presley and some of his friends flew to Colorado to consume them.
sandwiches.name: Fool's Gold Loaf

sandwiches.description: Peanut butter and marshmallow creme. Pictured is a fluffernutter sandwich prior to being assembled.
sandwiches.name: Fluffernutter

sandwiches.description: Wet-cured ham, linguiça, fresh sausage (chipolata), steak or other roast meat, topped with melted cheese, a hot thick tomato, and beer sauce
sandwiches.name: Francesinha

sandwiches.description: A bun with wet-cured ham, linguiça, and cheese, sauced with butter or margarine, piri-piri, and port wine, whiskey, cognac or brandy
sandwiches.name: Francesinha poveira

sandwiches.description: Thinly sliced roast beef on a baguette, served hot, usually au jus (with juice)
sandwiches.name: French dip

sandwiches.description: Sliced calves' brain on sliced bread
sandwiches.name: Fried brain

sandwiches.description: A traditional Maltese sandwich made on a large round piece of Maltese ftira bread, topped with tomato paste, tuna, capers and red onions.
sandwiches.name: Ftira

sandwiches.description: A deli-style sandwich similar to the hoagie, often contains french fries, with other variations, prepared with masala steak, chicken, polony, Vienna sausages, calamari, fish, or chargrilled steak
sandwiches.name: Gatsby

sandwiches.description: Half section of Italian or French bread with garlic butter, containing ham, provel or provolone cheese, topped with paprika, then toasted
sandwiches.name: Gerber

sandwiches.description: A tamale inserted in a Mexican bread, bolillo, easy to find in Mexico City streets in the morning, also called torta de tamal
sandwiches.name: Guajolota

sandwiches.description: "Pita gyro" or "psomaki gyro", depending on the type of bread used, includes meat roasted on a vertical spit, with tomato, raw, often red onion and optional yogurt sauce, wrapped in pita or sandwich bread.
sandwiches.name: Gyro

sandwiches.description: Chocolate sprinkles or flakes usually served on buttered bread
sandwiches.name: Hagelslag or vlokken

sandwiches.description: Ham, often with mustard
sandwiches.name: Ham

sandwiches.description: A common sandwich prepared with ham and sliced cheese. Additional ingredients may include lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise and other ingredients.
sandwiches.name: Ham and cheese

sandwiches.description: Sliced Danish canned ham with sliced scrabbled egg sheet in a halved-sweet bun
sandwiches.name: Ham and egg bun

sandwiches.description: A ground beef patty, often with vegetables, sauces and other meats, usually on a round bun.
sandwiches.name: Hamburger

sandwiches.description: A hot dog wrapped in a beef patty, deep-fried, then covered with chili, a few french fries, and a fried egg
sandwiches.name: Hamdog

sandwiches.description: A thick-sliced, toasted, open-faced sandwich, it usually contains hamburger patties or ham, but other meat, such as deep-fried pork tenderloin, grilled or fried chicken breast, and fried fish filets, can be used. The meat is topped with french fries and covered with a cheese sauce.
sandwiches.name: Horseshoe

sandwiches.description: Open-faced with turkey and bacon, topped with mornay sauce, and baked or broiled
sandwiches.name: Hot brown

sandwiches.description: Coarsely shredded or sliced chicken, sandwiched between two pieces of sliced bread, and completely covered with gravy.
sandwiches.name: Hot chicken

sandwiches.description: A cooked sausage, traditionally grilled or steamed and served in a sliced bun as a sandwich.
sandwiches.name: Hot dog

sandwiches.description: Often open-faced, sliced turkey on white bread drenched in turkey gravy, often served with mashed potatoes. These are sometimes served at Hofbrau-style restaurants.
sandwiches.name: Hot turkey

sandwiches.description: Vanilla ice cream between thin biscuits, cookies or slices of cake, normally chocolate
sandwiches.name: Ice cream

sandwiches.description: Thin slices of seasoned, juicy roast beef, often garnished with giardiniera or Italian sweet peppers, on a dense, long Italian-style roll
sandwiches.name: Italian beef

sandwiches.description: Not a sandwich, it refers to a set of toppings to put in a sandwich, refers to the colors of the Italian flag: red (tomato), white (mayonnaise) and green (avocado)
sandwiches.name: Italiano

sandwiches.description: Buttered bread, with jam (traditionally strawberry), normally eaten at lunchtime or as a quick snack, may also be eaten at breakfast or for high tea
sandwiches.name: Jam

sandwiches.description: A French baguette with butter and ham. Also known as "Parisien", it is the most popular sandwich in France.
sandwiches.name: Jambon-beurre

sandwiches.description: Meat, cheese, lettuce and tomato, between flattened, fried green plantains (instead of bread), with garlic-flavored mayonnaise
sandwiches.name: Jibarito

sandwiches.description: A cheeseburger with the cheese inside the meat patty rather than on top
sandwiches.name: Jucy Lucy

sandwiches.description: Breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet (tonkatsu)
sandwiches.name: Katsu sando

sandwiches.description: Lamb or goat intestines, containing seasoned offal
sandwiches.name: Kokoretsi

sandwiches.description: Buttered brown bread with smoked pork sausage (Kottenwurst), fresh onion rings and spicy mustard
sandwiches.name: Kottenbutter

sandwiches.description: Leberkäse is a meatloaf-like dish which, despite the name, contains neither liver nor cheese. It is commonly served on a Kaiser roll with mustard.
sandwiches.name: Leberkäse

sandwiches.description: Lettuce and mayonnaise
sandwiches.name: Lettuce

sandwiches.description: They are typically prepared with buttered rye bread, Limburger cheese, sliced onion and mustard. Pictured is Limburger cheese and bread.
sandwiches.name: Limburger sandwich

sandwiches.description: Lobster meat tossed with either mayonnaise ("cold") or drawn butter ("hot") stuffed into a slit opening at the top of a grilled bread roll or hot dog bun.
sandwiches.name: Lobster roll

sandwiches.description: Lox on a bagel with cream cheese, thinly sliced onion, capers and possibly sliced tomato
sandwiches.name: Lox

sandwiches.description: A hamburger or cheeseburger with a glazed doughnuts instead of a bun
sandwiches.name: Luther burger

sandwiches.description: Marmite spread thinly with butter or margarine onto toast or bread
sandwiches.name: Marmite

sandwiches.description: Filet américain (steak tartare) with Worcestershire sauce, pickles, onions, peppers and martino sauce
sandwiches.name: Martino

sandwiches.description: Meatballs in marinara sauce, with melted Parmesan or provolone cheese, on a long bun or section of Italian loaf. Might include Italian-style accompaniments such as bell peppers, basil, or Italian-dressed lettuce
sandwiches.name: Meatball

sandwiches.description: Roast pork, ham, mustard, Swiss cheese, and dill pickles served on sweet bread.
sandwiches.name: Medianoche

sandwiches.description: French fries and fried meat with sauce on a demi-baguette.
sandwiches.name: Mitraillette

sandwiches.description: A generic sandwich containing a filling, and a layer of cheese, grilled or fried until the cheese is melted
sandwiches.name: Melt

sandwiches.description: Open sandwich consisting of a sliced bun, topped with Mett (seasoned minced pork without bacon), frequently with a garnish of raw onion rings or diced raw onion
sandwiches.name: Mettbrötchen

sandwiches.description: A typical food of Mexico and a kind of bread in Spain. In Mexico, Molletes are prepared with melted cheese and beans with other ingredients, such as salsa, ham or bacon.
sandwiches.name: Mollete

sandwiches.description: Minute and usually grilled, could be filled with anything. Some bars offer a variety of 200 different types of these sandwiches.[citation needed]
sandwiches.name: Montadito

sandwiches.description: Sliced ham and cheese (usually Emmental or Gruyère) between slices of French toast and batter-fried. In some regions it is sprinkled with powdered sugar and served with jelly or jam). In other regions (New England), it is served savory with French mustard and no powdered sugar.
sandwiches.name: Monte Cristo

sandwiches.description: A sandwich made from cured and smoked brisket with yellow mustard, usually on rye bread.
sandwiches.name: Montreal-style smoked meat

sandwiches.description: Any sandwich containing mortadella, a large Italian sausage
sandwiches.name: Mortadella

sandwiches.description: A hot dog bun containing a Chicago-style corn-roll tamale, topped with chili
sandwiches.name: Mother-in-law

sandwiches.description: Originated in New Orleans' Italian-American community, meats, cheeses, and olive salad on a round bun
sandwiches.name: Muffuletta

sandwiches.description: Biscuit smeared with butter and topped with sugared aniseed balls, traditionally served in celebration of a birth
sandwiches.name: Beschuit met muisjes

sandwiches.description: A sandwich that consists of hamburger made with naan bread. Sometimes ham is used instead of beef.
sandwiches.name: Naan sandwich

sandwiches.description: Consists of a single slice of bread with one or more food items on top. See also pizza.
sandwiches.name: Open-faced sandwich

sandwiches.description: Made with pambazo bread dipped in a red guajillo pepper sauce and filled with potatoes with chorizo.
sandwiches.name: Pambazo

sandwiches.description: Round bread (bread bagnats) opened in two, rub each half with a clove of garlic, moisten with vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper, the choice can be added green salad, tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, tuna, anchovies, cucumbers, fava beans, small fresh artichokes, green peppers, radishes, fresh spring onions, basil and black olives of Nice. Serve chilled.
sandwiches.name: Pan-bagnat

sandwiches.description: In Italy, panino is the word for a sandwich made from bread other than sliced bread, in which case Italians call it a tramezzino. Examples of bread types used are ciabatta, rosetta and baguette. The bread is cut horizontally and filled with deli ingredients such as salami, ham, cheese, mortadella, or other food, and sometimes served warm after having been pressed by a warming grill. In the United States, United Kingdom and Canada, the term panini has been adopted to refer to a pressed and toasted sandwich; there is widespread availability and use of sandwich presses, often known as "panini presses" or "toasted sandwich makers."
sandwiches.name: Panini

sandwiches.description: Consists of a hamburger patty, pieces of sautéed or grilled onion and Cheddar or Swiss cheese between two slices of bread
sandwiches.name: Patty melt

sandwiches.description: Jam is often used in place of jelly. Also known as a 'PB&J'.
sandwiches.name: Peanut butter and jelly

sandwiches.description: A simple Argentine sandwich, traditionally filled with cheese, cured meat, tomato and mayonnaise. The term pebete actually refers to the bread used for the sandwich; a soft oval bun with a spongy inside, and a thin toasted crust.
sandwiches.name: Pebete

sandwiches.description: A stuffed and fried bread roll (sometimes called stuffed pistolettes) in the Cajun areas around Lafayette. Also refers to a type of submarine shaped bread about half the size of a baguette that is popular in New Orleans for Vietnamese bánh mì and other sandwiches.
sandwiches.name: Pistolette

sandwiches.description: A patty dish popular in the Balkan region of Southeastern Europe, a sandwich utilizes the Pljeskavica patty and bread.
sandwiches.name: Pljeskavica

sandwiches.description: A cold meal originating in the United Kingdom, commonly served in pubs. Its core components are (cheddar) cheese, ploughman's pickle and bread. It is traditionally eaten with beer.
sandwiches.name: Ploughman's lunch

sandwiches.description: A crusty bread loaf typically filled with fried seafood or roast beef.
sandwiches.name: Po' boy

sandwiches.description: Kielbasa sausage in a bun, covered with french fries, barbecue sauce (or hot sauce), and coleslaw
sandwiches.name: Polish boy

sandwiches.description: A half-inch slice of thick sausage, usually with diced red or sweet onion, sliced pickles, ketchup, mustard, and sometimes mayonnaise, on white bread
sandwiches.name: Porilainen

sandwiches.description: A popular dish in Macau, the bun is extremely crisp outside and very soft inside, and a freshly fried pork chop is filled into the bun horizontally.
sandwiches.name: Pork chop bun

sandwiches.description: The Pork Tenderloin sandwich features a thin, tenderized deep fried pork loin,usually served on a bun.
sandwiches.name: Pork tenderloin

sandwiches.description: Selection of grilled meats topped with french fries, coleslaw, and tomato on Italian bread
sandwiches.name: Primanti

sandwiches.description: Ham and turkey topped with broiled cheese. Sometimes includes bacon and tomato.
sandwiches.name: Prosperity Sandwich

sandwiches.description: This sandwich can be made in a pan. Margarine on the outside, pizza sauce and fillings on the inside. The term "pudgy pie" is sometimes used to refer to pie irons, a gadget used for campfire cooking.
sandwiches.name: Pudgy Pie

sandwiches.description: Form of barbecue in which pork is cooked using a slow cook method until the meat becomes tender enough that it can be "pulled", or easily broken into individual pieces
sandwiches.name: Pulled pork sandwich

sandwiches.description: Corned beef, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese, topped with Russian or Thousand Island dressing, on rye bread, then grilled
sandwiches.name: Reuben

sandwiches.description: Basic ingredients are eggs, chopped onions, sambal paste, salt and pepper cooked as an omelette with the bread added on top before it's fully cooked. Many variation includes canned sardines, chicken, beef, mutton. Garnished with mayo, chili sauce and cheese slice.
sandwiches.name: Roti john

sandwiches.description: Stewed pork, chopped finely, and stuffed in mo, a kind of flatbread
sandwiches.name: Rou jia mo

sandwiches.description: A bun filled with a mixture of (usually) loose meat, cabbage, and cheese. The fillings are baked inside the bread, similar to a kolache. Popular in the Midwestern United States, especially Nebraska.
sandwiches.name: Runza

sandwiches.description: Alternating layers of bread and filling frosted to resemble a layer cake
sandwiches.name: Sandwich loaf

sandwiches.description: Made with single-, double- or triple-layered, buttered, thin white bread with crust removed, toasted or untoasted, contains thinly sliced meat and may include ham, eggs, cheese, tomatoes, green peppers, lettuce, olives, and sometimes other vegetables, even asparagus.
sandwiches.name: De miga

sandwiches.description: Especially noted from Beigel Bake in Brick Lane, east London.
sandwiches.name: Salt beef bagel

sandwiches.description: Sausages, may be pork, beef or vegetarian. Served with red sauce, brown sauce or no sauce at all.
sandwiches.name: Sausage

sandwiches.description: Flat bread with fillings of beef, spinach, tomatoes, cucumber, tahini sauce wrapped and grilled. Other toppings to can be added.
sandwiches.name: Shawarma

sandwiches.description: Essentially a miniature hamburger about three inches in diameter, but may contain other ingredients besides a hamburger patty
sandwiches.name: Slider

sandwiches.description: Ground meat, usually beef, cooked with seasoned tomato sauce and served on a round bun.
sandwiches.name: Sloppy joe

sandwiches.description: A triple decker rye bread sandwich made with one or more types of sliced deli meat, such as turkey, ham, pastrami, corned beef, roast beef, or sliced beef tongue, along with Swiss cheese, coleslaw, and Russian dressing
sandwiches.name: Sloppy joe (New Jersey)

sandwiches.description: A square of thin chocolate bar topped with a toasted marshmallow between two squares of graham cracker
sandwiches.name: S'more

sandwiches.description: Multiple layers of white or light rye bread containing creamy fillings, such as egg and mayonnaise, liver paté, olives, shrimp, ham, various cold cuts, caviar, tomato, cucumber, cheese and smoked salmon
sandwiches.name: Smörgåstårta

sandwiches.description: Open-faced, buttered dark rye bread with cold cuts, pieces of meat or fish, cheese or spreads
sandwiches.name: Smørrebrød

sandwiches.description: An open-faced sandwich on rugbrød, with smoked herring, chives and a raw egg yolk
sandwiches.name: Sol over Gudhjem

sandwiches.description: A sizzling skewer of lamb, beef, pork or chicken roasted on a vertical grill, shaved off the spit, and marinade ranging from hot barbecue to sweet, all laid out on a rolled pita bread, sprinkled with your choice of lettuce, tomato, cheese, red onion, oregano and doused with tzatziki sauce.
sandwiches.name: Souvlaki

sandwiches.description: Marinated cubes of chicken, pork, lamb, veal, venison or beef, grilled on a spit, and served in a bun
sandwiches.name: Spiedie

sandwiches.description: An egg foo young patty (containing bean sprouts and minced white onions), dill pickle slices, white onion, mayonnaise, lettuce, and tomato on white bread
sandwiches.name: St. Paul

sandwiches.description: A grilled, over-stuffed submarine roll, containing shaved steak, and topped with salami, melted provolone, sautéed onions, and bell peppers.
sandwiches.name: Steak bomb

sandwiches.description: Prepared with steak that has been broiled, fried, grilled, barbecued or seared using steel grates or gridirons then served on bread or a roll. Steak sandwiches may include toppings such as cheese, onions, mushrooms, bell peppers, hot peppers, tomatoes, and in some instances fried eggs, cole slaw, and french fries.
sandwiches.name: Steak

sandwiches.description: A generic sandwich served on a long French or Italian roll which may contain a wide variety of sliced meats, vegetables, and condiments, including lettuce, tomato, sweet peppers, onions, olives, and/or mushrooms. Also known regionally as a hero, a hoagie, a grinder, or a zep, among other names. In the United Kingdom it is named a baguette, after the French bread used to make it.
sandwiches.name: Submarine/Sub sandwich/Baguette

sandwiches.description: Common in Iowa, consists of a mixture of unseasoned ground beef and sauteed onions, sometimes topped with pickles, ketchup and mustard, on a bun
sandwiches.name: Tavern

sandwiches.description: Thinly sliced white bread with crusts removed, lightly buttered, containing a light spread of cream cheese or mayonnaise mixture, and often radishes, cucumber, asparagus, or watercress. Other fillings may be pimento cheese, ham with mustard, smoked salmon, fruit jam, curried chicken, and egg salad.
sandwiches.name: Tea

sandwiches.description: Contains hot sopressata, capicola, and primadonna cheese, on a ciabatta roll, grilled, with balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, roasted red peppers, and sliced hot cherry peppers
sandwiches.name: The Scooch

sandwiches.description: Vegan version of the BLT: Smoky baked tempeh, lettuce, tomato and avocado served sourdough toasted bread
sandwiches.name: TLT (Tempeh, Lettuce, and Tomato)

sandwiches.description: A thin slice of toast between two thin slices of bread with a layer of butter, and adding salt and pepper to taste.
sandwiches.name: Toast

sandwiches.description: A slice of toast with ham, a maraschino cherry in the middle of a pineapple slice, and cheese, grilled from above, so the cheese starts to melt
sandwiches.name: Toast Hawaii

sandwiches.description: Two slices of bread with cheddar-like cheese (and sometimes ham) in between, which is then toasted or grilled
sandwiches.name: Toastie

sandwiches.description: Tofu with veggies. Typically broiled or baked tofu.
sandwiches.name: Tofu Sandwich

sandwiches.description: Sautéed beef tongue and scrambled eggs, served open-faced ada pav
sandwiches.name: Tongue toast

sandwiches.description: Round roll stuffed with sliced meat, sauce, and other ingredients, often made ahead and tightly wrapped to meld the filling with the bread.
sandwiches.name: Torta

sandwiches.description: Birote bread (bolillo) sliced open on one side, and filled with chopped, fried pork, and sometimes chicken or shredded meat, beans and cheese, served submerged in a sauce made mostly of a dried chile de árbol.
sandwiches.name: Torta ahogada

sandwiches.description: Triangular white bread with the crusts removed, with fillings such as tuna and olive and prosciutto, served in Italian bars throughout the day
sandwiches.name: Tramezzino

sandwiches.description: Although there are numerous variations, the main distinction is a combination of three meats, typically grilled, such as beef (usually churrasco steak or cube steak), roast pork (pernil), chicken, and ham. Condiments may include some combination of mustard, ketchup, and mayonnaise, often combined to create a “special” sauce. Popular toppings include thin crispy fried potato sticks or shoe string potatoes, thinly sliced cabbage, lettuce, onion, tomato, pickles, and Swiss cheese. The sandwich is often finished in a sandwich press until bread is toasted.
sandwiches.name: Tripleta

sandwiches.description: Usually made with tuna salad and includes ingredients such as mayonnaise and celery. Other common variations include the tuna boat and tuna melt.
sandwiches.name: Tuna

sandwiches.description: A potato fritter coated in chickpea flour (batata vada) in a bun
sandwiches.name: Vada pav

sandwiches.description: Vegemite is a dark brown Australian food paste made from used brewers' yeast extract, a by-product of beer manufacturing, various vegetables, wheat and spice additives. It is a spread for sandwiches, toast, crumpets and cracker biscuits as well as a filling for pastries.
sandwiches.name: Vegemite

sandwiches.description: Many types of vegetables are used to prepare vegetable sandwiches.
sandwiches.name: Vegetable

sandwiches.description: A hot melted cheese sauce, poured over slices (or other pieces) of toasted bread. Or the hot cheese sauce may be served in a bowl accompanied by the toast.
sandwiches.name: Welsh rarebit

sandwiches.description: Flat bread (often a tortilla) tightly wrapped around the sandwich filling with the ends tucked in to form a neat bundle, fillings can vary widely
sandwiches.name: Wrap

sandwiches.description: A simple and common German sandwich prepared with thin slices of lunch meat or sausage. Sometimes butter is added to add flavor.
sandwiches.name: Wurstbrot (sausage bread)

sandwiches.description: A hot dog bun stuffed with fried noodles, frequently topped with pickles, such as beni shōga, with mayonnaise
sandwiches.name: Yakisoba-pan

sandwiches.description: A halved baguette or other bread usually topped with mushrooms and cheese, ham or other meats, and vegetables
sandwiches.name: Zapiekanka
